name: http-genie.cgi-strncpy-001
notes: Further verification is required to confirm whether these strncpy calls indeed handle user-controllable HTTP parameters and the actual size of the destination buffers.

name: http-genie.cgi-snprintf-001
description: The use of snprintf to construct URL strings may include user-provided parameters. Although snprintf is relatively safe, it is still necessary to verify whether the format string and buffer size are sufficient.
notes: Check the format string and buffer size definitions.

name: http-genie.cgi-curl-001
description: It was discovered that using curl_easy_setopt to handle user-provided URLs may allow SSRF (Server-Side Request Forgery) attacks.
notes: Verify whether the URL contains user-controllable input and whether appropriate URL filtering is implemented.

name: http-genie.cgi-strstr-001
description: Multiple string search operations (strstr) were found processing HTTP response headers (X-Error-Code, X-Error-Message), potentially indicating injection vulnerabilities.
notes: Verify whether these header fields will be reflected back in the HTTP response.
